locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the theme of Jesus as the 'Man of Sorrows' and his radical loneliness. It moves from the historical context of Isaiah 53 to the psychological and spiritual reality of Jesus' rejection and ends with his intercession for the lonely.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher acknowledges the historical-critical view (Israel as the servant) but prioritizes a Christological reading ('New Testament eyes').

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is Assertive (describing Jesus' suffering) and Expressive (evoking sympathy/sadness), shifting late into Commissive (promising intercession).
voorbeelden: He is the Lord of the lonely.
I must raise a question with some of you as to how many times... you would not say 'yes' to Jesus.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort for the lonely and a sense of guilt/conviction for rejecting Jesus.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: He was despised and rejected of men.
The portrait that the prophet sets before us is of the Servant.
Never forget this price of loneliness.
I shudder when I read the words.
I fervently pray that there is somebody here.

commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak until the very end; the promise is descriptive rather than a direct 'I promise you on behalf of God'.

voorbeelden: He is the Lord of the lonely.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low; the preacher speaks mostly as a witness or teacher rather than a mandatory of the Keys of Heaven.

indicatoren: Extensive talk about what scholars say.
Long descriptions of the 6 o'clock news.
Speculation on Jesus' inner thoughts at the carpenter's bench.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of Jesus' loneliness rather than a participant in His grace.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about God's empathy, but no direct encounter with His transforming word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The toezegging (promise) is present but phrased as a general truth (Assertive) rather than a direct address (Commissive).

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's opinions and prayers ('I do not doubt', 'I hope').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used mostly for questioning or moral exhortation ('Have you rejected...?').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used at the end for comfort.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Isaiah, the news, scholars, and Jesus' history.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical and biographical distance.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Focus on Isaiah's writing and Jesus' earthly life.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about human loneliness and news cycles.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final comfort: 'He is praying for you'.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Jesus was lonely) -> Directive (Don't reject Him/Fight on).
voorbeelden: He traveled alone... Each of us must surely ask himself: Have I rejected the Savior?
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative (self-examination) precedes the declarative of grace, leading to moralism.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon lacks a clear Declarative shift where the preacher speaks for God.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: How many times have we cast the Lord out... Well, the Lord saw... he must be the way of loneliness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a meditation on the pathos of Jesus, providing information about His suffering to elicit an emotional and moral response.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I shudder when I read the words...
sterke_punten.effect: Creates emotional resonance with the text.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Analysis of the 6 o'clock news and scholarly views on Isaiah.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Distracts from the 'event' of the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is more of a lecture on the 'Man of Sorrows' than a sacramental encounter where the Lord actually meets the lonely hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher describes the means of grace (intercession) but does not effectively 'administer' it through the spoken word until the very last sentences.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. The preacher speaks about God.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. The preacher acts more as a religious commentator.
tekstueel_bewijs: I must raise a question with some of you...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly relies on the preacher's ability to evoke sympathy.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No, it is treated as a medium of reflection.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense assertives and third-person descriptions. Needs more present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: He is the Lord of the lonely.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In your loneliness right now, Christ comes to you and says: 'I am with you.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a fact about Jesus to an encounter with Jesus.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in a description of what the Bible says.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the authority of the office to declare the promise directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: On behalf of Christ, I promise you: you are not alone.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'You' of the congregation more frequently in the present tense.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who feel forgotten, hear this: Christ intercedes for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The call to 'fight on' is not sufficiently grounded in the finished work of Christ.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the victory of Christ's intercession before calling for the hearer's effort.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has deep emotional warmth but needs to move from 'talking about' Jesus to 'delivering' Jesus to the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (shuddering); SAT focuses on whether the 'Declarative' actually changes the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the vivid imagery of the news; SAT critiques it as a constative distraction from the illocutionary act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the orthodox content, the sermon remains 'stuck' in the 3rd person, preventing it from becoming a sacramental event.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He is despised and rejected of men.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High, but late in the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Man of Sorrows' trope to create a mood, which is a perlocutionary strategy rather than an illocutionary one.
